name: immanently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is a natural and permanent part of something: They cite this as evidence that man’s innate mental capacities develop immanently, regardless of the external world. The internet is continually, immanently open to re-creation.
More examplesFewer examplesThe forms of analysis arise immanently within only one very specific social context. Architecture is immanently political because it influences our social relations.Satisfaction, as a subjective category, is immanently related to a person or a group.
